meanings.definition: To defeat or gain more votes than someone or something in a decision-making process.
meanings.sent1: In the class election, Sarah outvotes all her competitors with her popular ideas.
meanings.sent2: The team captain outvotes the coach in deciding the game strategy.
meanings.sent3: The cat outvotes the dog on which spot by the window is the best for napping.
meanings.sent4: The sun outvotes the clouds, shining brightly through the day.
meanings.sent5: The determined student outvotes procrastination by studying diligently every day.

meanings.definition: To have a greater number of votes than someone or something in a vote or election.
meanings.sent1: During the election, the candidate outvotes all others, securing a landslide victory.
meanings.sent2: The new policy proposal outvotes the old one, receiving overwhelming support from the committee.
meanings.sent3: The ice cream flavor outvotes the cake flavor as the favorite among the party guests.
meanings.sent4: Laughter outvotes sadness, spreading joy and positivity in the room.
meanings.sent5: The aroma of freshly baked cookies outvotes any other scent in the kitchen.
